item.title: How to fix warning about ECDSA host key when SSH connection
item.description: This tutorial will explain how to fix warning about ECDSA host key when SSH connection. When establishing a new SSH connection, a fingerprint is cached. Hence, if you use the same IP address for several machines, a warning message can turn up. $ ssh dalanz@192.168.56.101 @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @ WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @ @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY! Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
